name: Rice, white, cooked
evidence: White rice is a refined grain providing energy but minimal fiber. Diets higher in whole grains (vs refined grains) show modest benefits for weight control and LDL cholesterol.

citations.title: Whole grain food diet slightly reduces cardiovascular risks in obese/overweight adults: a systematic review and meta-analysis
citations.author: Wang W et al.

name: Rice, brown, cooked
evidence: Brown rice retains the bran and germ, providing more fiber and micronutrients than white rice. Whole grain intake (like brown rice) is linked to better weight management and improved metabolic health markers.

citations.title: Whole grain food diet slightly reduces cardiovascular risks in obese/overweight adults: a systematic review and meta-analysis
citations.author: Wang W et al.
